CatDescriptText: Mariane Hill, insurance agent, Whitaker and Arthur L. Brown, steelworker, 2101 Webster Avenue, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 16, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "What do you think the main issues will be, or should be, in the coming presidential campaign?" Ms. Hill's answer reads: "World peace is the major issue.  Right now with all the talk of war this is the big issue.  They are placing a lot of emphasis on personality and religion, too."  Mr. Brown's answer reads: "Foreign policy and civil rights are especially important.  Maybe more civil rights would help foreign policy."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mariane Hill wearing plaid skirt and belt, standing in front of window with sign and paneled door with mullion windows; Portrait of Arthur L. Brown wearing light colored button down collared shirt with breast pockets, standing in front of brick wall
